# Aufgabe

Liefern Sie einen visuellen Überblick über fehlende Werte im Datensatz `penguins`! 




</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>

# Lösung

## Setup


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.1     ✔ readr     2.1.4
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.0
✔ ggplot2   3.4.2     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.2     ✔ tidyr     1.3.0
✔ purrr     1.0.1     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
d_path <- "https://vincentarelbundock.github.io/Rdatasets/csv/palmerpenguins/penguins.csv"
d <- read_csv(d_path)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
New names:
Rows: 344 Columns: 9
── Column specification
──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── Delimiter: "," chr
(3): species, island, sex dbl (6): ...1, bill_length_mm, bill_depth_mm,
flipper_length_mm, body_mass_g...
ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. ℹ
Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
• `` -> `...1`
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
nrow(d)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 344
```
:::
:::



## Weg 1


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(visdat)
vis_dat(d)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](filter-na4_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## Weg 2


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
d_na_only <- 
  d %>% 
  rowwise() %>% 
  mutate(na_n = sum(is.na(cur_data()))) %>% 
  ungroup()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning: There was 1 warning in `mutate()`.
ℹ In argument: `na_n = sum(is.na(cur_data()))`.
ℹ In row 1.
Caused by warning:
! `cur_data()` was deprecated in dplyr 1.1.0.
ℹ Please use `pick()` instead.
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
d_na_only %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = na_n)) +
  geom_bar()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](filter-na4_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::
